meanings.definition: The quality or state of being real.
meanings.sent1: The realnesses of the situation were undeniable.
meanings.sent2: She appreciated the realnesses of his emotions.
meanings.sent3: The realnesses of the puppy's attempt to howl made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His realnesses shone through in his heartfelt speech.
meanings.sent5: The realnesses of the forest at night were both beautiful and eerie.

meanings.definition: The fact or state of being actual or true.
meanings.sent1: The realnesses of the news shocked everyone.
meanings.sent2: They questioned the realnesses of the rumors spreading around.
meanings.sent3: The realnesses of the magic show left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: His smile revealed the realnesses of his happiness.
meanings.sent5: The realnesses of her words resonated with the audience.

meanings.definition: The quality of being genuine or authentic.
meanings.sent1: The realnesses of her apology were evident in her eyes.
meanings.sent2: He admired the realnesses of the antique furniture.
meanings.sent3: The realnesses of the chef's passion for cooking were contagious.
meanings.sent4: Her realnesses as a friend never failed to comfort him.
meanings.sent5: The realnesses of the painting made it stand out among the others.
